resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
tianchen92 commented on pull request #4933: ARROW-6022: [Java] Support equals API in ValueVector to compare two vectors equal
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4933
 
 
   Related to [ARROW-6022](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6022).
   
   In some case, this feature is useful.
   In ARROW-1184, Dictionary#equals not work due to the lack of this API.
   Moreover, we already implemented equals(int index, ValueVector target, int targetIndex), so this new added API could reuse it.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

emkornfield commented on pull request #4933: ARROW-6022: [Java] Support equals API in ValueVector to compare two vectors equal
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4933#discussion_r307589596
 
 

 ##########
 File path: java/vector/src/main/java/org/apache/arrow/vector/ValueVector.java
 ##########
 @@ -251,4 +251,29 @@
    * @return true if equals, otherwise false.
    */
   boolean equals(int index, ValueVector target, int targetIndex);
+
+  /**
+   * Check whether this vector equals to target vector.
+   * @param target target vector
+   * @return true if they have same type and elements, otherwise false
+   */
+  default boolean equals(ValueVector target) {
+    if (this == target) {
+      return true;
+    }
+    if (target == null || this.getClass() != target.getClass()) {
 
 Review comment:
   Have you thought about semantics of equality between NonNullable and NullableVersions?  
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

tianchen92 commented on pull request #4933: ARROW-6022: [Java] Support equals API in ValueVector to compare two vectors equal
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4933#discussion_r307591791
 
 

 ##########
 File path: java/vector/src/main/java/org/apache/arrow/vector/ValueVector.java
 ##########
 @@ -251,4 +251,29 @@
    * @return true if equals, otherwise false.
    */
   boolean equals(int index, ValueVector target, int targetIndex);
+
+  /**
+   * Check whether this vector equals to target vector.
+   * @param target target vector
+   * @return true if they have same type and elements, otherwise false
+   */
+  default boolean equals(ValueVector target) {
+    if (this == target) {
+      return true;
+    }
+    if (target == null || this.getClass() != target.getClass()) {
 
 Review comment:
   It reuse equals(int index，ValueVector target, int targetIndex) to compare each value which directly compares its underlying ArrowBuf，do we still need to worry about null value？Add logic to check isNull at index and targetIndex？
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

issuetype.description: A new feature of the product, which has yet to be developed.
issuetype.name: New Feature

fields.description:
In some case, this feature is useful.

In ARROW-1184, {{Dictionary#equals}} not work due to the lack of this API.

Moreover, we already implemented {{equals(int index, ValueVector target, int targetIndex)}}, so this new added API could reuse it.
fields.summary: [Java] Support equals API in ValueVector to compare two vectors equal
